Since Keelon is designed after GP3 (though the gas planet was later turned into a desert planet), it's kinda like a Uranus analog, Jool being Jupiter (Joolpiter) and Sarvin being Saturn (Sarvurn? I imagined it more like a moon with high mountain ranges and steep cliffs, so it's more like Slate, yes. I have some more ideas for that moon, though: how about a big canyon like Mars' Valles Marineris, or with some 'lakes' of water that still isn't frozen or thawed?

Well, instead of water, what about a strange black liquid made from hidocarbours like on Titan?

> 
> Well, instead of water, what about a strange black liquid made from hidocarbours like on Titan?

Liquid hydrocarbons are more orange-brownish than black, for a black liquid... I have no idea what that could possibly be. Hydrocarbon lakes are a good idea, though I envisioned it more like a frozen Earth. As for the heat that could melt part of the oceans, Manai could be the cause.

Right, right thank you. I kind of sort of have its image in mind: a slate-like much cooler blue-white icy moon with awesome blue atmosphere and blue-orange-brownish sea/lake shores, and beyond them, orange-brownish liquid hydrocarbon seas/lakes that make your engines have an almost unusable efficiency when touching the liquid.
As much as I love OPM, this mod brings a truly stock-alike feel.

Thank you! Planets were designed from original future planet ideas made by former dev Nova Silisko. The current version is preaty far from how they were supposed to look, but next version is a whole other story!

I actually thought of a snowy, icy moon with canyons, mountains and cliffs. It'd have gaps in the ice here and there that lead all the way to the moon's mantle, which is a global ocean. It'd be a mix of Uranus' moon Miranda, Saturn's moon Enceladus, Slate from OPM and Hoth from Star Wars.

Hey. Love the mod. I use this with OPM, Sigma Pluro-Khaton and TK. 

I edited some orbits to make some friends for Dres, put some stuff around OPM's Neidon and a couple more things around Plock, but have made no other changes to the cfg files for the planets. I just completed the stock generated 'Explore body' contract for Vix - which I haven't edited at all - but I ran into a an issue. I was able to enter orbit, descend and land on the big crater/flat side with no problems and my probe is visually safely sat on the surface, but according to the game, even though my probe is visually safely sat on the surface, all the science experiments register as 'in space flying above the surface' (on a suborbital trajectory) and the 'Land on Vix' part of the contract won't complete either. It's weird, because the craft is clearly not 'flying' because it doesn't move even after timewarp at the space center. I can't test timewarp while the vessel is active because it's registered as 'flying' at too low an altitude. Very bizarre.

It might be worth noting that the 'Landing Height' (set to Surface') mod said I had reached the surface at around 3000-4000 meters up, while 'Kerbal Engineer' seemed to correspond to what I was seeing.

Wondered if anyone else is having similar problems and if there are any ideas on what the problem could be? Also, what would you need from me to be able to look at the issue?

Cheers.
That's a known bug with several Kerbol Plus bodies. The workaround I use is to quicksave, then edit the quicksave to set the craft as landed, then reload.
OK. I used to cheat menu to complete the contract in the end. But yea, that sounds like a better interim solution. Cheers.
